core.forms.mixins module¶

class core.forms.mixins.SoftValidationMixin(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

This mixin will allow a form to submit even if specified fields have validator errors.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

get_soft_validation_fields()[source]¶
initial_clean()[source]¶

Cleans all of self.initial and populates self._errors

is_initial_visit() → bool[source]¶

Returns true if this is the first time we visit the page. Defaults to checking if the current instance has a primary key. Can be overridden to do this check in a different way. :return:

is_valid()[source]¶

This method is modified to only return False on hard errors

mark_soft_required(data, *fields)[source]¶

This can be used to validate a field as required, without actually making it required in the corresponding model.

save(commit=True)[source]¶

Save this form’s self.instance object if commit=True. Otherwise, add a save_m2m() method to the form which can be called after the instance is saved manually at a later time. Return the model instance.

This method is modified to only fail on hard errors
